C0304.name: missing-final-newline
C0304.rationale: Used when the last line in a file is missing a newline.\n\n

C0116.name: missing-function-docstring
C0116.rationale:
Missing function or method docstring used when a function or method has no 
docstring. Some special methods like `__init__`, protected, private functions,
setters and deleters do not require a docstring (learn more from testscases).
It's a good practice to describe what a function does for other programmers.

C0114.name: missing-module-docstring
C0114.rationale: Used when a module has no docstring. Empty modules do not require a docstring.\n\n

C0325.name: superfluous-parens
C0325.bad:
x = input()
y = input()
if (x == y):
    pass
C0325.rationale:
Used when a single item in parentheses follows an `if`, `for`, `or` other
keyword.

W0621.name: redefined-outer-name
W0621.bad:
var = 0


def foo(x, y):
    var = x + y
    return var
W0621.rationale: Used when a variable's name hides a name defined in the outer scope.\n\n

C0103.name: invalid-name
C0103.rationale:
Used when the name doesn't conform to naming rules associated to its type
(constant, variable, class...).

W0622.name: redefined-builtin
W0622.rationale: Used when a variable or function override a built-in.\n\n
